newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DSM to boost its polycarbonates position.
newsitem.headline: DSM to boost its polycarbonates position.

text.p: Dutch chemicals group DSM NV said on Thursday it has signed a long-term contract with the Dow Chemical Company giving it the right to draw polycarbonate resin from Dow's plant in Stade, Germany.
"The Dutch chemicals and materials group DSM will invest in the strenghtening of its worldwide position in polycarbonate," DSM said in a statement.
Dow has decided to increase current capacity at Stade by building a second production line with a capacity of at least 50,000 tonnes per year.
"The polycarbonate market has grown sharply - by around 10-15 percent a year - over the last few years," DSM said, adding it expected to grow a further 5-10 percent a year over the next few years.
